opennlp.ccg.hylo
Class HyloHelper

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.hylo.HyloHelper

public class HyloHelper
extends Object

A utility class to help with certain global operations over hybrid logic terms.

Version:
$Revision: 1.43 $, $Date: 2011/08/26 05:18:39 $
Author:
Jason Baldridge, Michael White

HyloHelper

public HyloHelper()
Method Detail

getLF

public static LF getLF(org.jdom.Element e)
Builds a Hylo term from the given element. An "lf" element may be used to wrap one or more (implicitly conj-ed) terms.

prefix

protected static String prefix(String name)
Returns the prefix of the name, up to an optional colon.

type

protected static SimpleType type(String name)
Returns the simple type given by the suffix of the name after the colon, or null if none.

getLF_FromChildren

public static LF getLF_FromChildren(org.jdom.Element e)
Returns a Hylo term from the children of the given element, adding an implicit CONJ op if necessary.

toXml

public static org.jdom.Element toXml(LF lf)
Returns an XML representation of the given LF, wrapped with an 'lf' element, removing CONJ ops that may be left implicit.

processChunks

public static void processChunks(org.jdom.Element e)
Processes and removes any chunk elements. Each chunk element is numbered, and all contained elements are marked as being contained by this chunk, via a "chunks" attribute.

isElementaryPredication

public static boolean isElementaryPredication(LF lf)
Returns whether the given LF is an elementary predication, ie a lexical predication, relation predication or attribute-value predication.

isLexPred

public static boolean isLexPred(LF pred)
Returns whether the given elementary predication is a lexical predication, ie one of the form @x(prop).

isRelPred

public static boolean isRelPred(LF pred)
Returns whether the given elementary predication is a relation predication, ie one of the form @x(<Rel>y).

isAttrPred

public static boolean isAttrPred(LF pred)
Returns whether the given elementary predication is an attribute-value predication, ie one of the form @x(<Rel>prop). Note that the prop is also allowed to be a HyloVar.

isAttr

public static boolean isAttr(LF arg)
Returns whether the given arg is an attribute-value pair, ie one of the form <Rel>prop. Note that the prop is also allowed to be a HyloVar.

getLexPred

public static String getLexPred(LF lf)
Returns the name of the lexical predicate of the given elementary predication, or null, if the given LF is not a lexical predicate.

getRel

public static String getRel(LF lf)
Returns the name of the relation of the given elementary predication, or null, if the given LF is not a relation or attribute-value predicate.

getVal

public static String getVal(LF lf)
Returns the string value of the attribute-value predicate, or null if the given LF is not an attribute-value predicate or has no value.

getPrincipalNominal

public static Nominal getPrincipalNominal(LF lf)
Returns the principal nominal the given elementary predication, or null, if the given LF is not an elementary predication.

getSecondaryNominal

public static Nominal getSecondaryNominal(LF lf)
Returns the secondary nominal of the given elementary predication, or null, if the given LF is not a relation predication.

flattenLF

public static LF flattenLF(LF lf)
Returns a flattened, sorted list of elementary preds from the given LF as a conjunction op, or as a single LF, if there is only one. LF chunks are preserved on satops, as are alts (exclusive disjunctions) and opts (optional parts). A runtime exception is thrown if the LF cannot be flattened.

getPreds

public static List<SatOp> getPreds(LF lf)
Returns a list of predications from the given LF, which is assumed to be either a conjunction of elementary predications or a single elementary predication.

getFirstPred

public static SatOp getFirstPred(LF lf)
Returns the first elementary predication from the given LF, which is assumed to be either a conjunction of elementary predications or a single elementary predication; otherwise returns null.

flatten

public static List<SatOp> flatten(LF lf)
Returns a flattened, sorted list of elementary preds from the given LF as a list. LF chunks are preserved on satops, as are alts (exclusive disjunctions) and opts (optional parts). Chunks, alts and opts are propagated through shared nominals. A runtime exception is thrown if the LF cannot be flattened.

firstEP

public static LF firstEP(LF lf)
Returns the first elementary predication in the flattened LF. A runtime exception is thrown if the LF cannot be flattened.

setOrigin

public static void setOrigin(LF lf,
                             LexSemOrigin origin)
Sets the origin of the elementary preds in the given LF (if any).

nomIndex

public static Map<Nominal,Integer> nomIndex(List<SatOp> preds)
Returns a map from nominals to index positions for the first EP for that nominal in a sorted list of elementary predications.

isRoot

public static boolean isRoot(Nominal nom,
                             List<SatOp> preds)
Returns whether a nominal is a root in the list of EPs using a linear search.

getUnfilledLexDeps

public static List<LexDependency> getUnfilledLexDeps(LF lf)
Returns the unfilled lexical dependencies for a lexical item's LF.

getFilledLexDeps

public static List<LexDependency> getFilledLexDeps(List<LexDependency> unfilled,
                                                   LF lf)
Returns the filled lexical dependencies from those in the unfilled list by checking the sign's LF for ones that have become filled, removing the corresponding no longer unfilled deps.

getSemFeatsForHead

public static List<SatOp> getSemFeatsForHead(Nominal nominal,
                                             LF lf)
Returns the semantic features (attribute-value preds) for the given nominal in the given LF.

compactAndConvertNominals

public static LF compactAndConvertNominals(LF lf,
                                           Nominal root)
Composes compact and convertNominals.

compactAndConvertNominals

public static LF compactAndConvertNominals(LF lf,
                                           Nominal root,
                                           Sign rootSign)
Composes compact and convertNominals with a root sign, for conversion using word positions.

compact

public static LF compact(LF lf,
                         Nominal root)
Returns a compacted LF from the given flattened one. A root nominal may also be given (otherwise null). Nominals with multiple parents are kept separate. If there are any duplicate predications, an attempt is made to attach them in different locations.

convertNominals

public static void convertNominals(LF lf)
Converts nominal vars to atoms, renaming them based on lexical propositions.

convertNominals

public static Nominal convertNominals(LF lf,
                                      Sign root,
                                      Nominal nominalRoot)
Converts nominal vars to atoms, renaming them based on word position, if a root sign is given, otherwise using lexical propositions; returns the converted nominal root.

append

public static LF append(LF lf1,
                        LF lf2)
Returns a the conjunction of the two LFs, either as a conjunction op, or as a single LF, if one is null. If either LF is itself a conj op, its elements are appended instead of the conj op itself. If both LFs are null, null is returned.

sort

public static void sort(LF lf)
Sorts the list of elementary predications in a conj op, or does nothing if the LF is not a conj op.

sort

public static void sort(List<? extends LF> preds)
Sorts a list of elementary predications.

check

public static void check(LF lf)
                  throws UnifyFailure
Checks the list of elementary predications in a conj op for well-formedness, or does nothing if the LF is not a conj op. A UnifyFailure exception is thrown if the check fails. The only current check is that there is no more than one lexical predication per nominal. The list of predications is assumed to be already sorted.

Throws:
UnifyFailure
